row.title: Why MyPART Focuses on Rare Cancer Research Infographic
row.field_short_title: Why MyPART Focuses on Rare Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: The My Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor network was created to engage patients in rare cancer research and connect them with researchers and clinicians. Rare cancers account for less than 40,000 new cases per year, and pediatric cancers are even more rare. This makes them hard to study, and hard to find treatments for.
row.field_feature_card_description: MyPART studies rare solid tumors affecting children and young adults.
row.field_list_description: MyPART studies rare solid tumors affecting children and young adults.
row.field_browser_title: Why MyPART Focuses on Rare Cancer Research
row.field_card_title: Why MyPART Focuses on Rare Cancer Research Infographic
row.body: Learn more about what makes a cancer “rare," why rare cancers are so hard to study, and why MyPART is working on rare cancers that affect children, teens, and young adults.
